Key Match Events: Grayson Allen hit his only 3-pointer of the game early in the fourth quarter to make it a six-point Suns lead and they pulled away after that.
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns have won three of four since coach Mike Budenholzer reorganized the Sunsâ€™ rotation with Bradley Beal coming off the bench.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns beat the Jazz for the third time this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns never trailed in a 114-106 victory over the Utah Jazz on Saturday.

Mason Plumlee scored the first five Suns points (six for the game) and finished with 10 rebounds, starting in place of Jusuf Nurkic, who did not play for the second straight game after serving a three-game suspension.
Others: The Jazz played without regulars Jordan Clarkson, Keyonte George and John Collins, but still got contributions from reserves Svi Mykhailiuk and Cody Williams with 13 points apiece.
